author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
Five persons were arrested by the police in connection with the murder of Dalit youth V. Shankar (22) in Udumalpet on Tuesday.

Shankar and his wife Kausalaya were attacked by a gang with deadly weapons on Sunday. While Shankar died, Kausalaya is recovering from the injuries.

The five arrested are M. Manikandan (25), P. Jegadeesan (31), M. Madan alias Micheal (23), P. Selvakumar (25) and M. Manikandan (39), all hailing from Dindigul district.

Two motorbikes and weapons believed to have been used in the attack were recovered.

Inspector General of Police (West Zone) C. Sridhar told The Hindu that the accused were actually friends of the girl’s father, Chinnasamy and their motive was to eliminate the girl. The accused will be produced before the court on Wednesday morning, he said.

The girl’s father had surrendered before a court at Nilakottai in Dindigul distrct on Monday.

Heavy police deployment was seen at Komaralingam, the native of Shankar, on Tuesday as a precautionary measure.
title: Five held for killing Dalit youth
